Value: Strongly alkaline; pH = 11.4 (1% w/v aqueous solution at 25°C).
One mole of sodium carbonate will gradually absorb 1 mole of water (approximately 15%) on exposure to air.
n²⁰ = 1.3352 at 1.0% w/w solution; 1.3440 at 5.0% w/w solution; 1.3547 for 10.0% w/w solution.
Freely soluble in water, with solubility initially increasing with temperature and then settling at 30.8% w/w above 80°C. Soluble in glycerin; practically insoluble in ethanol (95%).
